Class PlayerPiece

java.lang.Object
greenfoot.Actor
PlayerPiece
public class PlayerPiece extends greenfoot.Actor
Represents a player's game piece -- player 1's pieces (for player index 0) are straight-faced, player 2's pieces (for player index 1) are smiling
Version:
2.0
Author:
cwfloyd@email.uscb.edu

  • Constructor Summary

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    act()
    The `act` method for the PlayerPiece is fairly simple since most of the game logic is handled by the GameBoard class; but we will use the `act` method to set the opacity (transparency) of the object depending on whether or not the piece is moveable
    int
    getGameBoardLocationIndex()
    Getter (accessor) method for retrieving the current gameBoardLocationIndex for this PlayerPiece
    int
    getOriginalXcoord()
    Getter (accessor) method for retrieving the original X-coordinate (horizontal coordinate) of this PlayerPiece
    int
    getOriginalYcoord()
    Getter (accessor) method for retrieving the original Y-coordinate (vertical coordinate) of this PlayerPiece
    int
    getTargetGameBoardLocationIndex()
    Getter (accessor) method for retrieving the possible game board location index based on the current die roll
    boolean
    isMoveable()
    Getter (accessor) method for retrieving this player piece's `moveable` state value (true or false) NOTE: While it is a common Java convention to name "getter" methods by concatenating the prefix `get` with the name of the corresponding instance variable (while obeying camelCase rules), it is usually preferable (more readable) to use the prefix `is` when the corresponding instance variable is of type `boolean`
    void
    setGameBoardLocationIndex(int gameBoardLocationIndex)
    Setter (mutator) method for UPDATING the gameBoardLocationIndex for this PlayerPiece

    Updates the moveable state of this PlayerPiece object

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerPiece

      public PlayerPiece(int playerIndex, int originalXcoord, int originalYcoord)
      Initializes a newly-instantiated PlayerPiece object
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player that "owns" this PlayerPiece (0 = player one pieces, 1 = player two pieces)
      originalXcoord - the original X-coordinate of where this playerPiece was located for this player's "starting zone"
      originalYcoord - the original Y-coordinate of where this playerPiece was located for this player's "starting zone"

  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act()
      The `act` method for the PlayerPiece is fairly simple since most of the game logic is handled by the GameBoard class; but we will use the `act` method to set the opacity (transparency) of the object depending on whether or not the piece is moveable
      Overrides:
      act in class greenfoot.Actor

    • isMoveable

      public boolean isMoveable()
      Getter (accessor) method for retrieving this player piece's `moveable` state value (true or false) NOTE: While it is a common Java convention to name "getter" methods by concatenating the prefix `get` with the name of the corresponding instance variable (while obeying camelCase rules), it is usually preferable (more readable) to use the prefix `is` when the corresponding instance variable is of type `boolean`

    • setMoveable

      public void setMoveable(boolean moveable)
      Updates the moveable state of this PlayerPiece object
      Parameters:
      moveable - whether this object should be moveable or not
